description:
This course aims to impart skills to help individuals manage their personal finances, and private wealth. 



Topics 

The course has two parts. Part I covers basic aspects of financial planning:



    Understanding key steps in financial planning

    Financial statements and ratios

    Time value of money

    Short and long term financial planning

    Liquidity management

    Credit management



The second part of the course focuses on private wealth management.  Topics include:



    Fixed income investment strategies

    Equity investment strategies

    Mutual funds 

    Structured products

    Hedge funds and other alternative investments

    Investing in real estate 

    Taxation, estate planning and wealth protection



Target Audience

The course is primarily intended for individuals who wish to improve their money management skills. However, it is also suitable for those who aspire to be independent financial advisors or a career in private wealth management.
title: SIF: Personal Finance and Private Wealth Management
